intro: Melothria subsessilis, commonly known as the small sour sop, is a species of flowering plant in the Cucurbitaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its trailing or climbing habit, with hairy, heart-shaped leaves. Its small, yellow-orange fruits are typically about 2–3 centimeters in diameter. The fruit has a distinctive, acidic flavor and is often used in local cuisines and traditional medicine.
